title: CW Simon game (Project TouCans)
description: Build the CW Simon game: randomized Morse sequence playback, user input matching via iambic keyer, scoring, configuration, and replay UI.

title: Single letter output
description: Add a Start Game button on the page. On click, send a K by calling sendMorseMessage. Modify sendMorseMessage so it uses key press/release (not conn.send msgDown/msgUp) and overlays the text argument in very large font while audio plays. The letter fades away when audio stops; a variable controls fade time with default 500ms. Create new files pt-simon.js and cwsimon.html, and update the build script.
acceptance_criteria: Clicking Start Game plays a K, shows large K during audio, and fades after ~500ms unless configured. sendMorseMessage uses key press/release. pt-simon.js and cwsimon.html exist and are wired by the build script.

title: Implement and test the letter chooser
description: Create the list of letters and numbers with corresponding Morse code (from existing CW practice list). Implement a random chooser that selects from the list, and track letters already played so the sequence can be replayed before the next letter is appended.
acceptance_criteria: Chooser returns valid letters from the list only. Sequence state is preserved and can be replayed in order before adding the next random letter.

title: Play incrementally increasing sequence on button click
description: When the user clicks the Start Game button, play the current sequence: first the existing letters in order, then the new random letter from the chooser. This repeats each round, increasing by one letter each time.
acceptance_criteria: Each round plays the full sequence plus one new letter; sequence length increments by one per round and preserves order.

title: Implement user input morse code via existing iambic keyer
description: Integrate the existing iambic keyer interface to capture player input (dits/dahs) without changing how the keyer input works. Display the currently output Morse letter in a large font (from step 1) while audio plays.
acceptance_criteria: Player input is captured through the existing keyer with no behavioral changes. Input is available to be checked against the sequence.

title: Add checking code in startIambic using toneUnits
description: Add checking code in startIambic to compare player input against what was sent using toneUnits. On incorrect input, play a losing sound (configurable on/off), display how many letters were correct, and prompt "do you want to play again" with an OK button that restarts the game. Implement scorekeeping (rounds completed). Add user configuration for WPM (default 8), and separate letter speed and word speed controls.
acceptance_criteria: Incorrect input triggers losing sound (when enabled), shows score, and offers OK to restart. Score equals rounds completed before mistake. WPM defaults to 8; letter speed and word speed are independently configurable.
